summary: Calculus & Linear Algebra provides the mathematical toolkit essential for engineering and science. This course covers differentiation, integration, sequences, series, and vector spaces. You'll develop analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities through rigorous mathematical methods. These concepts are fundamental for modeling real-world phenomena. Mastering this subject opens doors to advanced engineering courses and research opportunities.
recommended_books: Calculus – George B. Thomas & Ross L. Finney
Linear Algebra: A Modern Introduction – Poole
Higher Engineering Mathematics – B. S. Grewal
course_outcomes: Remember various techniques of integration and apply them to evaluate improper integrals.
Understand sequence and series concepts, tests of convergence, Taylor and power series, and apply them to problems.
Apply partial differentiation and multiple integration to evaluate engineering problems.
Understand matrices, determinants, inverse, and solve linear systems using Gauss Elimination.
Apply vector space concepts, rank-nullity, linear maps, eigenvalues & eigenvectors to solve mathematical problems.
